attributes.action: Dissolution of the United Kingdom State and the establishment of a British Republic
attributes.additional_details:
The government of the United Kingdom State - including all senior politicians, civil servants, administrators, business leaders, military, police, and security chiefs, judges, media figures, clergy, and especially the Windsor family - would step down from high office and go into quiet retirement on modest pensions.

Instead of taking any more orders from the above assortment of incompetents and outright criminals, the ordinary people of Britain would take full control of their own destinies for the first time.  All national resources would be placed under public control and equitably distributed.

The super-exploitation of the Third World by British corporations would cease, and the British military personnel who had hitherto enforced this criminal status quo would be returned home, and henceforth employed for the purposes of national defence only.
